patch 8.2.1234: Lua build problem with old compiler

Problem:    Lua build problem with old compiler.
Solution:   Move declarations to start of the block. (Taro Muraoka,
            closes #6477)

patch 8.2.1235: Not all mouse codes covered by tests

Problem:    Not all mouse codes covered by tests.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/e859312e748297bde67a053fd3c486fc2c14b532|patch 8.2.1236: Vim9: a few errors not caught by try/catch>
patch 8.2.1236: Vim9: a few errors not caught by try/catch

Problem:    Vim9: a few errors not caught by try/catch.
Solution:   Do not bail out if an error is inside try/catch.  Fix that a not
            matching catch doesn't jump to :endtry.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1236: Vim9: a few errors not caught by try/catch · vim/vim@e859312
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1236: Vim9: a few errors not caught by try/catch · vim/vim@e859312
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: a few errors not caught by try/catch. Solution: Do not bail out if an error is inside try/catch. Fix that a not matching catch doesn't jump to :endtry.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/447bfba24b231777a79bf53cdb33f44d9691e47e|patch 8.2.1237: changing 'completepopup' after opening popup has no e…>
patch 8.2.1237: changing 'completepopup' after opening popup has no effect

Problem:    Changing 'completepopup' after opening a popup has no effect. (Jay
            Sitter)
Solution:   Close the popup when the options are changed. (closes #6471)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1237: changing 'completepopup' after opening popup has no e… · vim/vim@447bfba
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1237: changing 'completepopup' after opening popup has no e… · vim/vim@447bfba
attachments.text: …ffect Problem: Changing 'completepopup' after opening a popup has no effect. (Jay Sitter) Solution: Close the popup when the options are changed. (closes #6471)

patch 8.2.1227: Vim9: allowing both quoted and # comments is confusing

Solution:   Only support # comments in Vim9 script.

attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: allowing both quoted and # comments is confusing. Solution: Only support # comments in Vim9 script.
